title: make.bat says "export" to set environment variables.
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
tip

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
Windows 8.1 64 bits

3. What did you do?
I don't have any C compiler installed. When I run "make.bat" I get the following error message:

##### Building Go bootstrap tool.
cmd/dist

go tool dist: cannot invoke C compiler "gcc": exec: "gcc": executable file not found in %PATH%

Go needs a system C compiler for use with cgo.
To set a C compiler, export CC=the-compiler.
To disable cgo, export CGO_ENABLED=0.

4. What did you expect to see?
Windows console uses "set CC=the-compiler" instead of export.
